source:
{title: Put Your Hand to the Plough}
{key: Dm}
{reviewed: false}

{section: Verse 1}
[Dm]If you want to do God's will,
You must struggle to fulfill,
Put your [Gm]hand to the plo[A7]ugh, hold on[Dm].
The lesson's clear in history, we are sure you will agree,
Put your [Dm]hand to the plo[A7]ugh, hold on[Dm].

{section: Chorus}
[F]Hold on, hold on[Dm],
Put your h[G7]and to the plo[A7]ugh, hold o[Dm]n,
[F]Hold on, hold on[Dm],
Put your h[Gm]and to the plou[A7]gh, hold on[Dm].

{section: Verse 2}
Jacob laboured many years, shedding floods and floods of tears,
Put your hand to the plough, hold on.
Every price he freely paid, so foundation could be laid,
Put your hand to the plough, hold on.

{section: Verse 3}
Moses went to Pharaoh's throne,
said, 'My people must go home!'
Put your hand to the plough, hold on.
He persisted to the end, so Pharaoh could not defend,
Put your hand to the plough, hold on.

{section: Verse 4}
Jesus hung upon the cross, and it seemed that all was lost,
Put your hand to the plough, hold on.
But his death was not in vain, and God started work again,
Put your hand to the plough, hold on.
